nodes.text: Jabba's Baroque Musical is a musical theme of the Star Wars movies. It was composed by John Williams and appeared in the film Return of the Jedi during Jabba the Hutt's introductory scene.

This music was designed to function as background material. Its purpose is to establish a court ambiance in Jabba's palace. It is intended to be diegetic music (a sound whose source is visible on the screen). Despite the name of the track, this sounds more like classical (à la Haydn or Mozart) than baroque music.

Jabba's Baroque Recital consists of a traverso, chamber organ, and harpsichord, complete with an Alberti bass motion. It is presented in 3/4 time, much like a minuet, and is in A-B-A-C-A (ornamented) form.
